intro: Rhynchospora tenella, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its inflorescence consists of a dense spike of small, three-ranked flowers, which are usually green to reddish in color. Rhynchospora tenella plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wetland organisms.
